intro: Piptothrix pubens, commonly known as the pubescent thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fruit is a round, fleshy berry that turns red when ripe, containing numerous small seeds. Piptothrix pubens is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and desert scrub habitats.
